intro: Pilosella schneidii, commonly known as the Sierra needlegrass, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its fine, needle-like leaves and small yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky slopes. It is a perennial herb that produces a compact, upright growth form. Pilosella schneidii plays a role in stabilizing soil and providing habitat for small invertebrates in its native range.
